tuv.seg: • Eligibility for jury service
• Incháilitheacht do sheirbhís ghiúiré
• Payment on jury service
• Íocaíocht maidir le seirbhís ghiúiré
Most non-minor criminal offences require a trial by a judge and jury
Is gá triail faoi bhreitheamh agus giúiré leis an gcuid is mó de chionta coiriúla nach mionchionta iad
Some civil cases, for example, defamation, require a jury trial
Teastaíonn triail ghiúiré ó chásanna sibhialta áirithe, an aithis, mar shampla
Information on what jurors do is available in our document on the role of a jury
Tá eolas ar cad a dhéanann giúróirí ar fáil inár ndoiciméad ar an ról a bheadh ​​giúiré
Jurors are contacted by summons of the County Registrar, which will state that you are obliged to attend for jury service on a particular date
Déantar teagmháil le giúróirí trí thoghairm ón gCláraitheoir Contae, a shonróidh go bhfuil sé d’iallach ort freastal faoi choinne sheirbhís ghiúiré ar dháta faoi leith
Eligibility for jury service
Incháilitheacht do sheirbhís ghiúiré
Every Irish citizen from the age of 18 (no upper age limit since 1 January 2009) who is on the Register of Dáil Electors is eligible for jury service except:
Bíonn gach saoránach na hÉireann ó 18 bliain d’aois atá ar Chlár na dToghthóirí Dála incháilithe do sheirbhís ghiúiré cé is moite de:
• Those involved in any way with the administration of justice
• Iad siúd a mbíonn baint acu in aon slí le riaradh an cheartais

This includes judges, former judges, the President, the Attorney General, the Director of Public Prosecutions, members of the Gardai and defence forces, prison officers, practising barristers, solicitors, court officers such as registrars and personnel in Government departments involved in matters of justice or the courts

Áirítear leo seo breithiúna, iar-bhreithiúna, an tUachtarán, an tArd-Aighne, An Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí, baill den Gharda agus Óglaigh na hÉireann, oifigigh phríosúin, abhcóidí cleachtais, aturnaetha, oifigigh na cúirte ar nós cláraitheoirí agus pearsanra sna Ranna Rialtais a mbíonn baint acu le cúrsaí ceartais nó leis na cúirteanna
• Those who are unable to read or have a long-term impairment so that it is not practicable for them to serve on a jury
• Iad siúd nach bhfuil in ann a léamh nó a bhfuil mallachar fadtéarmach ionas nach bhfuil sé indéanta dóibh chun fónamh ar ghiúiré

The rules about eligibility for jury service in Ireland are set down in Section 6 and the First Schedule of the Juries Act, 1976 as amended by Section 54 and Section 64 of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2008

Leagtar síos na rialacha i gcomhair incháilitheachta do sheirbhís ghiúiré i Alt 6 agus an Chéad Sceideal de Acht na nGiúiréithe, 1976 arna leasú ag Alt 54 agus Alt 64 den Acht um an Dlí Sibhialta (Forálacha Ilghnéitheacha) 2008
The following persons are disqualified from jury service:
Bíonn na daoine seo a leanas dícháilithe ó sheirbhís ghiúiré:
• Those who have been convicted of a serious offence in Ireland
• Iad siúd a ciontaíodh i gcion tromchúiseach in Éirinn
• Those who have ever been sentenced to a term of imprisonment of five years or more
• Iad siúd ar gearradh téarma príosúnachta de chúig bliana nó ní ba mhó orthu riamh
• Those who, within the last ten years, have been sentenced to a term of imprisonment of three months
• Iad siúd ar gearradh téarma príosúnachta de thrí mhí orthu raimh le deich mbliana anuas
• People living in Ireland who are not Irish citizens
• Daoine a chónaíonn in Éirinn nach saoránaigh na hÉireann iad
Those who are excused as of right
Iad siúd a scaoiltear ón giúiré de bharr a gceart
The following persons may be excused as of right from jury service:
Féadfar scaoileadh leis na daoine seo a leanas ó sheirbhís ghiúiré de bharr a gceart:
• Since January 2009 those aged 65 or over
• Ó Eanáir 2009, siúd atá 65 bliain d'aois nó os a chionn

• Members of the either House of the Oireachtas (the Irish Parliament), members of the Council of State, the Comptroller and Auditor General, the Clerks of Dáil Éireann and Seanad Éireann, a person in Holy Orders, a minister of any religious denomination or community, members of monasteries and convents, aircraft pilots, full-time students and ship's masters

• Baill de Thithe an Oireachtais (ceachtar teach), baill den Chomhairle Stáit, an tArd-Reachtaire Cuntas agus Ciste, Cléirigh Dháil Éireann agus Seanad Éireann, duine in Ord Beannaithe, ministéir d’aon sainchreideamh nó pobal creidimh, baill de mhainistreacha nó clochair, piolótaí aerárthaigh, mic léinn lán-aimseartha agus máistirí loinge
• Those who provide an important community service, such as practising doctors, nurses, midwives, dentists, vets, chemists, etc
• Iad siúd a sholáthraíonn seirbhís thábhachtach don phobal, ar nós dochtúirí, altraí, cnáimhseacha (mná cabhrach), fiaclóirí, tréidlianna, poitigéirí srl

• The following persons if it is certified that their functions cannot reasonably be performed by another person or postponed; members of staff of either House of the Oireachtas, Heads of Government Departments, other civil servants, chief executive officers and employees of local authorities, Health Service Executive (HSE) Areas and harbour authorities, school teachers and university lecturers

• Na daoine seo a leanas má dheimhnítear nach féidir le duine eile a bhfeidhmeanna a dhéanamh go réasúnta nó nach fhéidir iad a chur siar; baill fhoirne de cheachtar Teach an Oireachtais, Cinn de Ranna Rialtais, státseirbhísigh eile, príomhoifigigh fheidhmiúcháin agus fostaithe na n-údarás áitiúil, na mbord sláinte agus údaráis na gcuanta, múinteoirí scoile agus léachtóirí ollscoile
• Those who have served on a jury within the last three years or who have been excused by a judge at the conclusion of a previous period of service for a period that has not ended
• Iad siúd a bhí ar ghiúiré cheana le trí bliana anuas nó ar scaoil breitheamh leo ag deireadh thréimhse seirbhíse roimhe seo do thréimhse seirbhíse nach bhfuil críochnaithe
Other occasions when you may be excused
Ócáidí eile ar ar féidir scaoileadh leat
Other occasions when you may be excused include:
Áirítear leis na hócáidí eile ar ar féidir scaoileadh leat:
• The County Registrar or the trial judge may excuse you if he is satisfied that there is "good reason" for doing so
• Féadann an Cláraitheoir Contae nó breitheamh na trialach scaoileadh leat má cheapann siad go bhfuil "cúis mhaith" ann leis
• At the end of a case of "an exceptionally exacting nature", the trial judge may excuse the jury from jury service for as long as the judge considers fit
• Ag deireadh cáis "de mianach dian eisceachtúil", féadann breitheamh na trialach scaoileadh leis an ngiúiré ó sheirbhís ghiúiré ar feadh chomh fada agus is oiriúnach leo é
The rules about ineligibility and disqualification from jury service are set out in Section 7 and Section 8 of the Juries Act, 1976
Leagtar amach na rialacha faoi neamh-incháilitheacht agus dícháiliú ó sheirbhís ghiúiré in Alt 7 d’Acht na nGiúiréithe, 1976 agus in Alt 8 d’Acht na nGiúiréithe, 1976
Under the Juries Act, the following offences are punishable by fines:
Déantar teagmháil le giúróirí trí thoghairm ón gCláraitheoir Contae
• Failing to attend for jury service without reasonable excuse, or not being available when called upon to serve as a juror or being unfit for service by reason of drink or drugs
Ní mór duit freagairt don toghairm ghiúiré trí úsáid a bhaint as an fhoirm agus an clúdach litreach réamh-íoctha a sholáthraítear
• Making or causing to be made on behalf of a person summoned as a juror any false representations to enable him or her to evade jury service. Selection of jurors
Má thiteann tú laistigh de na catagóirí daoine a mbíonn sé de cheart acu a bheith saor ó sheirbhís ghiúiré, caithfidh tú é sin a mhaíomh ar an fhoirm a sholáthraítear
If you wish to be excused for another reason (such as illness), you must state that reason and the County Registrar will make a decision as to whether or not you may be excused
Más mian leat go scaoilfear leat ó do dhualgais ar chúis eile (ar nós tinnis), caithfidh tú an chúis sin a shonrú agus déanfaidh an Cláraitheoir Contae cinneadh an féidir tú a scaoileadh saor
All the jury members summonsed that are not excused must attend in court on the first day the panel is formed
Gach giúróir a dtugtar toghairm dóibh, ní mór dóibh freastal ar an gcúirt ar an gcéad lá a chuirtear painéal an ghiúiré le chéile
The name of every juror is called out and you must answer to show you are in attendance
Glaoitear ainm gach giúróir agus caithfidh tú freagairt chun a léiriú go bhfuil tú i láthair
In order to select a panel of 12 jurors for a particular case, names are drawn out of a ballot box
Tarraingítear ainmneacha ó bhosca ballóide chun is go gcuirfí painéal 12 giúróir le chéile

If your name is called, you will go to the jury box and you will be given an opportunity to state if you are ineligible for or disqualified from jury service or if you know any of the witnesses in the case

Má ghlaoitear d’ainm rachaidh tú i mbosca na ngiúróirí agus tabharfar deis duit le maíomh más neamh-incháilithe nó dícháilithe ó sheirbhís giúiré tú nó más aithnid duit aon duine de na finnéithe sa chás

Section 23 of the Courts and Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2013 amended the Juries Act 1976 so that the jury can consist of up to 15 members, if the case is expected to last more than 2 months

Leasaigh Alt 23 den Acht gCúirteanna agus Dlí Sibhialta (Forálacha Ilghnéitheacha) 2013 an tAcht na nGiúiréithe 1976 ionas gur féidir leis an giúiré comhdhéanta de suas le 15 ball, má táthar ag súil an cás go deireanach níos mó ná 2 mhí
Even though you are called for jury service, you may not actually serve
B’fhéidir nach ndéanfaidh tú seirbhís ghiúiré fiú má ghlaoitear ort chun seirbhís ghiúiré
Usually more people than necessary are called
Glaoitear ar níos mo daoine ná mar is gá de ghnáth
You must return to court every day, whether or not you are sworn onto a jury panel, unless otherwise directed by the court
Caithfidh tú filleadh ar cúirt gach lá, is cuma an gcuirtear faoi mhionn ar phainéal giúiré nó nach gcuirtear, mura dtreoraíonn an chúirt a mhalairt duit
Before you give your oath, either side in the case may challenge you
Is féidir le ceachtar taobh den chás agóid a dhéanamh i do choinne sula dtugann tú do mhionn
This is simply an objection to a proposed juror
Níl anseo ach agóid i gcoinne giúróra mholta
Each side may challenge 7 potential jurors without giving any reason and may challenge any number of jurors if they can "show cause"
Féadann gach taobh agóid a dhéanamh i gcoinne 7 giúróirí féideartha gan aon chúis a thabhairt leis agus is féidir leo agóid a dhéanamh i gcoinne aon líon giúróirí más féidir leo "cúis a léiriú" leis
If you are challenged without reason being given, you will leave the jury box
Má bhíonn agóid déanta i do choinne agus gan cúis tugtha leis, fágfaidh tú bosca na ngiúróirí
If you are challenged with reason, it is the judge who decides whether or not you will serve
Má thugtar cúis leis an agóid, is é an breitheamh a chinnfidh an dtabharfaidh tú seirbhís nó nach dtabharfaidh
The members of the jury who have been selected will individually swear an oath or affirm that they will properly try the issue and give a true verdict according to the evidence
Tabharfaidh an ball den ghiúiré atá roghnaithe mionnú ina n-aonar nó dearbhóidh siad go dtriailfidh siad an cheist i gceart agus go dtabharfaidh siad breithiúnas fírinneach de réir na fianaise
When the jury is sworn in and before the case starts, it will select a foreman from its members
Nuair a bhíonn an giúiré curtha faoi mhionn agus sula dtosaíonn an cás, roghnaíonn sé príomhghiúróir oná bhaill
The foreman acts as an informal chairperson and spokesperson of the jury
Gníomhaíonn an príomhghiúróir mar chathaoirleach neamhfhoirmiúil agus mar urlabharaí an ghiúiré
Payment on jury service
Íocaíocht maidir le seirbhís ghiúiré
There is no payment for jury service
Níl aon íocaíocht ar sheirbhís ghiúiré
Travelling expenses are not allowed
Ní cheadaítear do chostais taistil
If you are actually serving as a juror, lunch will be provided on the day or days that the trial is at hearing
Má bhíonn tú ag feidhmiú ar ghiúiré, cuirfear lón ar fáil ar an lá nó ar na laethanta a mbeidh an triail á héisteacht
If you are self-employed and work alone and where your attendance at jury service may mean you cannot earn a living, you may qualify for excusal from jury service

Más féin-fhostaithe tú agus go n-oibríonn tú i d’aonar, agus sa chás go gciallódh do sheirbhís ghiúiré nárbh fhéidir leat do bheatha a thuilleamh, d’fhéadfadh sé go gcáileodh tú le do scaoileadh ó sheirbhís ghiúiré
Contact the jury office of the Court for more information
Déan teagmháil le hoifig ghiúiré na Cúirte lena thuilleadh eolais
If you are signing on for a Jobseeker's payment you will continue to be paid, but you should advise your local Social Welfare Office that you have been called for jury service
Mar sin féin, ba chóir duit comhairle a chur ar d'Oifig Leasa Shóisialaigh áitiúil go bhfuil tú bheith ar a dtugtar le haghaidh seirbhíse giúiré
If you are in employment, the Juries Act 1976 (Section 29) places a duty on your employer to allow you attend for jury service
Má bhíonn tú i bhfostaíocht, leagann Acht na nGiúiréithe 1976 (Alt 29) dualgas ar d’fhostóir a ligean duit freastal ar sheirbhís ghiúiré
It is further specified in the law that time spent on jury service is to be treated as if the employee were actually employed
Sonraítear sa dlí freisin go gcaithfear leis an seal ar sheirbhís ghiúiré mar is go mbeadh an fostaí i bhfostaíocht iarbhír
In other words, if you are in employment and are attending for jury service, you are entitled to be paid while you are away from work
I bhfocail eile, má bhíonn tú fostaithe agus ag freastal ar sheirbhís ghiúiré, bíonn tú i dteidil d’íocaíochta agus tú ar shiúl ó do chuid oibre
Anyone with a contract of employment (i.e., temporary workers, contract workers, etc.) is entitled to be paid by their employer while they are on jury service
Bíonn aon duine faoi chonradh fostaíochta (.i. oibrithe páirt-aimseartha, oibrithe conartha, srl.) i dteidil íocaíochta óna bhfostóir fad is a bhíonn siad ar sheirbhís ghiúiré
There should also be no loss of any other employment rights while you serve on a jury
Níor cheart go gcaillfí aon chearta eile fostaíochta le linn duit a bheith ar ghiúiré ach an oiread
The Jury office will provide a certificate of attendance on request
Soláthróidh an Oifig Ghiúiré teastas tinrimh ach é a iarraidh

If you feel your employment rights have been infringed or you have lost employment rights while serving on a jury, you can make a complaint to the Workplace Relations Commission using the online complaint form available on workplacerelations.ie

Má bhraitheann tú gur sáraíodh do chearta fostaíochta nó gur chaill tú cearta fostaíochta le linn duit a bheith ag freastal ar ghiúiré, is féidir leat gearán a dhéanamh leis an gCoimisiún um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre tríd an fhoirm ghearáin a úsáid á fáil ar workplacerelations.ie
Read more about enforcing your employment rights here
Léigh tuilleadh faoi chearta fostaíochta a chur i bhfeidhm anseo
